feed.title: Dan Friedman's Data & Programming Knowledge Base - Python

entry.title: Subtract the Product and Sum of Digits of an Integer (via Leetcode)
entry.summary: Walkthrough of easy python algorithm problem from Leetcode to subtract the product of its digits from the sum of its digits
entry.content:

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,

  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}

}

}

}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;

  line-height: 1.21429em;

  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;

/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;

  font-size: 14px;

}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {

}

div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */

.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Problem setup:</strong></p>
<p>This problem can be found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/subtract-the-product-and-sum-of-digits-of-an-integer/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>Given an integer number <code>n</code>, return the difference between the product of its digits and the sum of its digits.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Test-Cases">Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-Cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert subtract_product_and_sum(35) == 27</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Product of digits = 3 * 5 = 35</li>
<li>Sum of digits = 3 + 5 = 8</li>
<li>Difference = 35 - 8 = 27</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert subtract_product_and_sum(235) == 20</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Product of digits = 2 <em> 3 </em> 5 = 30</li>
<li>Sum of digits = 2 + 3 + 5 = 10</li>
<li>Difference = 30 - 10 = 20</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># define function to with argument for num</span>
    <span class="c1"># cast num to a string to be able to iterate over its digits</span>
    <span class="c1"># assign variable to hold product of digits as 1</span>
    <span class="c1"># assign variable to hold sum of digits as 0</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># iterate over each digit in string version of number:</span>
        <span class="c1"># cast string digit to an integer</span>
        <span class="c1"># product of digits = product of digits * integer digit</span>
        <span class="c1"># sum of digits = sum of digits * integer digit</span>
    <span class="c1"># assign variable difference to be product of digits minus sum of digits</span>
    <span class="c1"># return difference</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>My solution above is the simplest possible solution. I wouldn't dwell on space and time complexity here. There's minimal space used as only 3 variables are created (no data structures). For time complexity, the simplest possible operation is done which is a single iteration over each digit in the input integer.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">subtract_product_and_sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">str_n</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">product_of_digits</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">sum_of_digits</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">number</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">str_n</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">int_n</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">number</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">product_of_digits</span> <span class="o">*=</span> <span class="n">int_n</span>
        <span class="n">sum_of_digits</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">int_n</span>
    <span class="n">diff</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">product_of_digits</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">sum_of_digits</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">diff</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Verify-test-cases">Verify test cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Verify-test-cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">subtract_product_and_sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">35</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">27</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">subtract_product_and_sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">235</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">20</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

entry.title: Find All Numbers Disappeared in an Array (via Leetcode)
entry.summary: Walkthrough of easy python algorithm problem from Leetcode to find all numbers that don't appear in the array given some conditions

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}





.rendered_html pre,




.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,


.rendered_html tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #f5f5f5;
}
.rendered_html tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(66, 165, 245, 0.2);
}
.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,


.rendered_html * + .alert {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
[dir="rtl"] 
div.text_cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.text_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.text_cell_render {
  /*font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, sans-serif;*/
  outline: none;
  resize: none;
  width: inherit;
  border-style: none;
  padding: 0.5em 0.5em 0.5em 0.4em;
  color: #000;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
}
a.anchor-link:link {
  text-decoration: none;
  padding: 0px 20px;
  visibility: hidden;
}
h1:hover .anchor-link,
h2:hover .anchor-link,
h3:hover .anchor-link,
h4:hover .anchor-link,
h5:hover .anchor-link,
h6:hover .anchor-link {
  visibility: visible;
}
.text_cell.rendered .input_area {
  display: none;
}
.text_cell.rendered 
.text_cell.rendered .rendered_html tr,
.text_cell.rendered .rendered_html th,
.text_cell.rendered 
.text_cell.unrendered .text_cell_render {
  display: none;
}
.text_cell .dropzone .input_area {
  border: 2px dashed #bababa;
  margin: -1px;
}
.cm-header-1,
.cm-header-2,
.cm-header-3,
.cm-header-4,
.cm-header-5,
.cm-header-6 {
  font-weight: bold;
  font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
}
.cm-header-1 {
  font-size: 185.7%;
}
.cm-header-2 {
  font-size: 157.1%;
}
.cm-header-3 {
  font-size: 128.6%;
}
.cm-header-4 {
  font-size: 110%;
}
.cm-header-5 {
  font-size: 100%;
  font-style: italic;
}
.cm-header-6 {
  font-size: 100%;
  font-style: italic;
}

.highlight .se { color: #BB6622; font-weight: bold } /* Literal.String.Escape */
.highlight .sh { color: #BA2121 } /* Literal.String.Heredoc */
.highlight .si { color: #BB6688; font-weight: bold } /* Literal.String.Interpol */
.highlight .sx { color: #008000 } /* Literal.String.Other */
.highlight .sr { color: #BB6688 } /* Literal.String.Regex */
.highlight .s1 { color: #BA2121 } /* Literal.String.Single */
.highlight .ss { color: #19177C } /* Literal.String.Symbol */
.highlight .bp { color: #008000 } /* Name.Builtin.Pseudo */
.highlight .fm { color: #0000FF } /* Name.Function.Magic */
.highlight .vc { color: #19177C } /* Name.Variable.Class */
.highlight .vg { color: #19177C } /* Name.Variable.Global */
.highlight .vi { color: #19177C } /* Name.Variable.Instance */
.highlight .vm { color: #19177C } /* Name.Variable.Magic */
.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Problem setup</strong></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This problem is on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/find-all-numbers-disappeared-in-an-array/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>Given an array of integers where 1  a[i]  n (n = size of array), some elements appear twice and others appear once.</p>
<p>Find all the elements of [1, n] inclusive that do not appear in this array.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Test-Cases">Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-Cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert find_disappeared_numbers_in_array([1, 3, 4, 3]) == [2]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this test case, the size of the array is 4, assigned to <code>n</code>. All elements of <code>[1, n]</code> would be <code>[1, 2, 3, 4]</code>. However, the input list does not contain <code>2</code>. Therefore, this test case should return 2.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert find_disappeared_numbers_in_array([5, 6, 1, 5, 6, 1]) == [2, 3, 4]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this test case, the the size of the array is 6. All elements of <code>[1, n]</code> would be <code>[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]</code>. However, the array doesn't contain <code>[2, 3, 4]</code> and so our function should return that.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># build a python set of all numbers from i to n with n being the size of the array. </span>

<span class="c1"># iterate over input list</span>
    <span class="c1"># if item in set:</span>
        <span class="c1"># pop item out of set</span>

<span class="c1"># return: convert set to a list</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Explanation of space and time complexity</strong>:</p>
<p>Let <code>n</code> be the number of elements in the input list assigned to the variable <code>nums</code>.</p>
<p>I iterate over <code>n</code> and therefore it's an O(n) time complexity. There a is another O(1) check for membership in the set that is done O(n) times. Total time complexity is O(2n). The 2 is negligent so most people say this is just O(n) time complexity.</p>
<p>I initially create a Python set of values from 1 to the value of <code>n</code>. Therefore, this is an O(n) space complexity.</p>
<p>Here is a <a href="https://wiki.python.org/moin/TimeComplexity" target="_blank">great resource</a> on time complexity operations in Python.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_disappeared_numbers_in_array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">length_nums</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">all_numbers_set</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">length_nums</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>

    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">num</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">nums</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">all_numbers_set</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">all_numbers_set</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">remove</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">all_numbers_set</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Verify-Test-Cases">Verify Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Verify-Test-Cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_disappeared_numbers_in_array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_disappeared_numbers_in_array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

entry.title: Number of Steps to Reduce a Number to Zero (via Leetcode)
entry.summary: Walkthrough of easy python algorithm problem from Leetcode to count number of steps to reduce a number to zero

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

.CodeMirror {

  font-size: 14px;

.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */

  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes

}

</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This problem can be found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/number-of-steps-to-reduce-a-number-to-zero/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>Given a non-negative integer <code>num</code>, return the number of steps to reduce it to zero. If the current number is even, divide it by 2; otherwise, subtract one from it.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Write-out-Test-Cases">Write out Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Write-out-Test-Cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert number_of_steps(8) == 4</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To elaborate on test case above. Here are the steps:</p>
<p>1) <code>num</code> of 8 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 4</p>
<p>2) <code>num</code> of 4 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 2</p>
<p>3) <code>num</code> of 2 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 1</p>
<p>4) <code>num</code> of 1 is odd; subtract 1; <code>num</code> equals 0</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert number_of_steps(14) == 6</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To elaborate on test case above. Here are the steps:</p>
<p>1) <code>num</code> of 14 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 7</p>
<p>2) <code>num</code> of 7 is odd; subtract 1; <code>num</code> equals 6</p>
<p>3) <code>num</code> of 6 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 3</p>
<p>4) <code>num</code> of 3 is odd; subtract 1; <code>num</code> equals 2</p>
<p>5) <code>num</code> of 2 is even; divide by 2; <code>num</code> equals 1</p>
<p>6) <code>num</code> of 1 is odd; subtract 1; <code>num</code> equals 0</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># define function to take in num</span>
    <span class="c1"># set a variable for count of steps</span>
    <span class="c1"># while num is not equal to 0:</span>
        <span class="c1"># if num is even:</span>
            <span class="c1"># reassign num to be num divided by 2</span>
        <span class="c1"># else:</span>
            <span class="c1"># number is odd...</span>
            <span class="c1"># reassign num to be num minus 1</span>
        <span class="c1"># increment count of steps variable by 1</span>
    <span class="c1"># return count of steps</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>My solution above is the simplest possible solution. I wouldn't worry about time or space complexity considerations here. Time complexity is <em>roughly</em> O(n/2) and space complexity is simply O(1) for the one variable created.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_of_steps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">count_of_steps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">num</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">num</span> <span class="o">/=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="c1"># number is odd...</span>
            <span class="n">num</span> <span class="o">-=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">count_of_steps</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">count_of_steps</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Verify-test-cases">Verify test cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Verify-test-cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">number_of_steps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">4</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">number_of_steps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">6</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This problem can be found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/how-many-numbers-are-smaller-than-the-current-number/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>Given the array <code>nums</code>, for each <code>nums[i]</code> find out how many numbers in the array are smaller than it. That is, for each <code>nums[i]</code> you have to count the number of valid <code>j</code>'s such that <code>j != i</code> and <code>nums[j] < nums[i]</code>.</p>
<p>Return the answer in an array.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Test-Cases">Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-Cases">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert smaller_numbers_than_current([8, 1, 2, 2, 3]) ==[4, 0, 1, 1, 3]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In the test case above, here is my reasoning for the solution:</p>
<table>
<thead><tr>
<th>index in input list</th>
<th>number</th>
<th>numbers in list smaller than number</th>
<th>count numbers in list smaller than number</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>0</td>
<td>8</td>
<td>[1, 2, 2, 3]</td>
<td>4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>1</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>[ ]</td>
<td>0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>[1]</td>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>3</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>[1]</td>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>4</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>[1, 2, 2]</td>
<td>3</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert smaller_numbers_than_current([7, 7, 7, 7]) ==[0, 0, 0, 0]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In the test case above, here is my reasoning for the solution:</p>
<table>
<thead><tr>
<th>index in input list</th>
<th>number</th>
<th>numbers in list smaller than number</th>
<th>count numbers in list smaller than number</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>0</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>[ ]</td>
<td>0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>1</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>[ ]</td>
<td>0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>[ ]</td>
<td>0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>3</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>[ ]</td>
<td>0</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This pseudocode doesn't cover every detail - but most of the high-level logic.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># create a function that takes in a list of numeric values</span>

    <span class="c1"># created sorted list </span>
    
    <span class="c1"># iterate over item in sorted list</span>
        <span class="c1"># make dictionary with keys as item and value as count of items smaller than it</span>
        
    <span class="c1"># create empty output_list</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># iterate over each item in input list</span>
        <span class="c1"># look up in the item as a key in the dictionary and add value to output_list</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let <code>n</code> be the length of items in the input list.</p>
<p>The sorted list will hold <code>n</code> values and so space complexity is O(n). The dictionary can hold up to <code>n</code> unique values which in the worst case scenario is <code>n</code>; space complexity is O(n). Total space complexity is O(n) + O(n) which is O(2n).</p>
<p>Time complexity to create a sorted list is O(nlogn). Iteration over the sorted list is O(n). Iteration over the input list is O(n). Therefore, total time complexity is O(2n) + O(nlogn).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">logging</span>
<span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">basicConfig</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DEBUG</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%(asctime)-25s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(levelname)-7s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(lineno)-4s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(message)-8s</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>                      
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">smaller_numbers_than_current</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_list</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">sorted_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"sorted_list: </span><span class="si">{sorted_list}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"dictionary: keys are items in input list; values = count of nums smaller than item"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create variable for running count of nums smaller than item in list"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"1st number in input list will always have 0 elements smaller than it"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"add item: 0 to the dict"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span>
    
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"iterate from index of 1 to length of sorted_list"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">)):</span>

        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"num: </span><span class="si">{sorted_list[index]}</span><span class="s2"> & previous_num: </span><span class="si">{sorted_list[index-1]}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>        
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"increment count_nums_smaller by 1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"this num in iteration is not equal to previous num in sorted_list"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"add key-value pair to dictionary"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span>  
              
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num: </span><span class="si">{dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">output_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"for each item in input list, append dict[item] to output list"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">item</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">input_list</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dict_count_nums_smaller_than_num</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">]</span> 
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"count of numbers smaller than </span><span class="si">{item}</span><span class="s2"> is </span><span class="si">{count_nums_smaller}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">output_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">count_nums_smaller</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">output_list</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */

  /* Old browsers */

  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;

  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);

}

</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This problem can be found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/longest-common-prefix/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.</p>
<p>If there is no common prefix, return an empty string "".</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Test-Cases">Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-Cases">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this test case, the longest common prefix of characters among the three strings is "fl"</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [51]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert longest_common_prefix(["flower", "flow", "flight"]) == "fl"</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this test case, there are no common prefix characters among the three strings so the function should return an empty string.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [52]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert longest_common_prefix(["dog", "racecar", "car"]) == ""</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [54]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># create a function that takes in a list of strings</span>

    <span class="c1"># letter_at_index = ""  # stores our running letter to compare to each word</span>
    <span class="c1"># final_string = ""  # hold longest common prefix that will be the return value</span>

    <span class="c1"># this condition is here because the code to calculate the length of the first item in the input list of strings would cause an error...</span>
    <span class="c1"># if length of the input list of strings is 0:</span>
        <span class="c1"># there are no strings to evaluate so immediately return final_string</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># assign variable to be length of one of the input strings</span>

    <span class="c1"># iterate from letter_index of range 0 to one of the length of the input strings:</span>
        <span class="c1"># iterate over each string in list and keep track of index too</span>
            
            <span class="c1"># add try block b/c we'd want our function to end when we reach an index error in the except statement below</span>
                <span class="c1"># if we're iterating over first list item</span>
                    <span class="c1"># letter_at_index = this letter in first list item</span>
                <span class="c1"># else if letter_at_index is not equal to the letter in this list item:</span>
                    <span class="c1"># use the last saved common prefix among strings</span>
                    <span class="c1"># return final_string</span>
                <span class="c1"># else:  </span>
                    <span class="c1"># pass</span>
            <span class="c1"># except index error:</span>
                <span class="c1"># at this point we may be trying to access a character in a strong beyond its max index...</span>
                <span class="c1"># break out of function and return final_string</span>
                
        <span class="c1"># finished iteration of comparing same index among strings...</span>
        <span class="c1"># letter_at_index exists in all strings so append it to final string </span>
        <span class="c1"># assign letter_at_index to a blank string</span>

    <span class="c1"># we've finished iteration and all strings are the same!</span>
    <span class="c1"># return final_string</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I want to cover the space and time complexity here.</p>
<p><code>n</code> is the length of elements in <code>list_of_strings</code>. <code>m</code> is the length of the longest string in <code>list_of_strings</code>.</p>
<p>My iteration could be over all possible letters in each string so it's an O(mn) time complexity operation.</p>
<p>There are a few variables created that are each an O(1) space complexity operation. Since they're all very small, space complexity is essentially O(1).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [93]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">list_of_strings</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">letter_at_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
    <span class="n">final_string</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
    
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">list_of_strings</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">final_string</span>
    
    <span class="n">length_of_a_string</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">list_of_strings</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># compare the letter at an index for each string and see if they match...</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">index_in_string</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">length_of_a_string</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">index_in_list_of_strings</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">string</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">list_of_strings</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>    
                <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">index_in_list_of_strings</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="n">letter_at_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index_in_string</span><span class="p">]</span>
                <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index_in_string</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="n">letter_at_index</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">final_string</span>
                <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="k">pass</span>
            <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">IndexError</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">final_string</span>
        <span class="c1"># letter_at_index is the same across all strings so add this letter to final_string</span>
        <span class="n">final_string</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">letter_at_index</span>
        <span class="c1"># reassign letter_at_index to be an empty string</span>
        <span class="n">letter_at_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">final_string</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Validate-Code-with-Test-Cases">Validate Code with Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Validate-Code-with-Test-Cases">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [94]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"flower"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"flow"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"flight"</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">"fl"</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [95]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"flower"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"flower"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"flower"</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">"flower"</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [96]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"racecar"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"car"</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [97]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [98]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [100]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">longest_common_prefix</span><span class="p">([])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;

.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}

}

  border-top-left-radius: 2px;

    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */

  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */

}

}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {

}
