/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;

  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;

}
div.out_prompt_overlay {

  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {

  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {

/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {

</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This example was found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/valid-parentheses/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>I'll extensively walk through how I'd solve this problem.</p>
<h3 id="Problem-statement">Problem statement<a class="anchor-link" href="#Problem-statement">¶</a></h3><p>You're given a string containing just the following characters: <code>"(", ")", "{", "}", "[", "]"</code>. Determine if the input string is valid.</p>
<p>Open brackets must be closed by the same type of brackets. Open brackets must be closed in the correct order. An empty string is also considered valid.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Test-cases">Test cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-cases">¶</a></h3><p><strong>Test case #1</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Input: <code>"[]"</code></li>
<li>Output: <code>True</code></li>
<li>Reasoning: The open bracket is closed by the same type of bracket in the correct order.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Test case #2</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Input: <code>"[{]}"</code></li>
<li>Output: <code>False</code></li>
<li>Reasoning: The first closing bracket of <code>"]"</code> closes that type out before the a previous <code>"["</code> needed to be closed first. Open brackets <em>are not</em> closed in the correct order.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Test case #3</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Input: <code>"({}]"</code></li>
<li>Output: <code>False</code></li>
<li>Reasoning: The open bracket of <code>"("</code> is never closed. There's a closing bracket of <code>"["</code> but that doesn't match.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Test case #4</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Input: <code>"[[{}]]"</code></li>
<li>Output: <code>True</code></li>
<li>Reasoning: All open brackets are closed by the same type of brackets and in the correct order. </li>
</ul>
<p>I can write out <code>assert</code> statements in Python for these 4 test cases and the empty string consideration one.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert valid_parentheses("[]") == True</span>

<span class="c1"># assert valid_parentheses("[{]}") == False</span>

<span class="c1"># assert valid_parentheses("({}]") == False</span>

<span class="c1"># assert valid_parentheses("[[{}]]") == True</span>

<span class="c1"># assert valid_parentheses("") == True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Logic-for-Solution">Logic for Solution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Logic-for-Solution">¶</a></h3><p>I will have to examine every element in the input string. Therefore, I should iterate over it. A string is a Python sequence that allows for iteration over every element.</p>
<p>When I think about the input <code>"[{]}"</code>, I know that every successive open bracket must be closed by the same type <em>before</em> an earlier open bracket is closed. Let me write out a few step-by-step examples on how I'd solve this.</p>
<p>One data structure that comes to mind here is a stack. A stack stores elements in what seems like a list, but it is optimized by time complexity for operations by last-in-first-out - aka "LIFO" - and first-in-first-out - aka "FIFO".</p>
<p>A stack optimized data structure in Python is found in the <code>collections</code> package and <code>deque</code> module. For a <code>deque</code>, use the <code>append</code> method to insert an element into the end of the structure and <code>pop</code> to remove an element from the end of the structure.</p>
<p>Operations for <code>"[{]}"</code>:</p>
<ol>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"["</code>. Since it's an open bracket, append to deque b/c open bracket.</li>
<li>Iterate over <code>"{"</code>. Since it's an open bracket, append to deque b/c open bracket.</li>
<li>Iterate over <code>"]"</code>. Since it's a closed bracket, compare this to the last item in the deque. This element is a different type than the last item in the deque. Therefore, return False.</li>
</ol>
<p>Operation for <code>"[[{}]]"</code>:</p>
<ol>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"["</code>. Since it's an open bracket, append to deque b/c open bracket.</li>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"["</code>. Since it's an open bracket, append to deque b/c open bracket.</li>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"{"</code>. Since it's an open bracket, append to deque b/c open bracket.</li>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"}"</code>. Since it's a closed bracket, compare this to the last item in the deque. This is element is the same type as the last item in the deque. Pop out last item added to deque.</li>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"]]"</code>. Since it's a closed bracket, compare this to the last item in the deque. This is element is the same type as the last item in the deque. Pop out last item added to deque.</li>
<li>Iterate over element <code>"]"</code>. Since it's a closed bracket, compare this to the last item in the deque. This is element is the same type as the last item in the deque. Pop out last item added to deque.</li>
<li>Return True</li>
</ol>
<p>This pseudocode generally explains the step logic.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># from collections import deque</span>

<span class="c1"># create a function with string as an input</span>
    <span class="c1"># create an empty deque</span>
    <span class="c1"># create dict in which keys are open brackets and values are of the same type closed brackets</span>

    <span class="c1"># iterate over each character in input string</span>
        <span class="c1"># if it's an open bracket</span>
            <span class="c1"># append item to deque</span>
            
        <span class="c1"># else if it's a closed bracket and there are no brackets in our stack</span>
            <span class="c1"># we can't add a closed bracket as the first in our stack b/c it's invalid</span>
            <span class="c1"># return False</span>
        <span class="c1"># else:  # it's a closed bracket</span>
            <span class="c1"># if this closed type is the same as the last open type in the stack</span>
                <span class="c1"># pop out last item in deque</span>
            <span class="c1"># else:</span>
                <span class="c1"># this is the wrong match so return False to break out of function</span>
    <span class="c1"># finished iteration...</span>
    <span class="c1"># if length of deque is 0 meaning all open brackets have been closed properly</span>
        <span class="c1"># return True</span>
    <span class="c1"># else:  # there are open brackets that haven't been closed</span>
        <span class="c1"># return False</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Code">Code<a class="anchor-link" href="#Code">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">collections</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">deque</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">logging</span>

<span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">basicConfig</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DEBUG</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%(asctime)-25s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(levelname)-7s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(lineno)-4s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(message)-8s</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>                      


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">brackets_string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    Compute if a string is a valid parentheses string such as "{}" or "{[[]]}"</span>
<span class="sd">    </span>
<span class="sd">    param brackets_string: the string to validate if it's a valid parentheses</span>
<span class="sd">    return boolean: True if brackets_string is a valid parentheses</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign empty deque to open_brackets_stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">deque</span><span class="p">()</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create dict in which keys are open brackets and values are of the same type closed brackets"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">bracket_pair_dict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'['</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">']'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                         <span class="s1">'{'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'}'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                         <span class="s1">'['</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">']'</span>
                        <span class="p">}</span>
    
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"iterate over each character in input string..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">bracket</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">brackets_string</span><span class="p">:</span> 
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"bracket: </span><span class="si">{bracket}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"check if bracket is an open type..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">bracket</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">bracket_pair_dict</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"append bracket to stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">bracket</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">bracket</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">bracket_pair_dict</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"closed bracket can't be the first item in a valid stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"under this condition we have a closed bracket and there are items in the stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="si">{bracket}</span><span class="s2"> is a closed bracket..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"check if this closed type is the same as the last open type in our stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">last_open_in_stack</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"last_open_in_stack: </span><span class="si">{last_open_in_stack}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">bracket_pair_dict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">last_open_in_stack</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">bracket</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"we have a match of same open and closed type..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"pop out last item in stack..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pop</span><span class="p">()</span>
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"we have a mismatch of the open and closed type..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
            
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"loop has finished..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">open_brackets_stack</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"length of stack is 0 so all open brackets have been closed in proper order..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"still open brackets in the so they haven't been properly closed..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"[]"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>2020-03-14 18:12:04,558   DEBUG   9    assign empty deque to open_brackets_stack...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,559   DEBUG   12   create dict in which keys are open brackets and values are of the same type closed brackets
2020-03-14 18:12:04,561   DEBUG   18   iterate over each character in input string...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,562   DEBUG   20   bracket: [
2020-03-14 18:12:04,563   DEBUG   21   check if bracket is an open type...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,564   DEBUG   23   append bracket to stack...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,566   DEBUG   20   bracket: ]
2020-03-14 18:12:04,567   DEBUG   21   check if bracket is an open type...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,569   DEBUG   29   under this condition we have a closed bracket and there are items in the stack...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,570   DEBUG   30   ] is a closed bracket...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,570   DEBUG   31   check if this closed type is the same as the last open type in our stack...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,571   DEBUG   33   last_open_in_stack: [
2020-03-14 18:12:04,572   DEBUG   36   we have a match of same open and closed type...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,573   DEBUG   37   pop out last item in stack...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,574   DEBUG   43   loop has finished...
2020-03-14 18:12:04,575   DEBUG   45   length of stack is 0 so all open brackets have been closed in proper order...
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Turn off logging messages for the rest of the test cases.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logger</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">getLogger</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">logger</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">disabled</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"[{]}"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">False</span>

<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">]"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">False</span>

<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"[[</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">]]"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">True</span>

<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">valid_parentheses</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}





.rendered_html pre,




.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,


.rendered_html tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #f5f5f5;
}
.rendered_html tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(66, 165, 245, 0.2);
}
.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,


.rendered_html * + .alert {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This example was found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/median-of-two-sorted-arrays/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>In this tutorial, I'll walk extensively through my logic for solving this problem.</p>
<p><strong>Problem statement</strong>:</p>
<p>There are two sorted arrays, <code>nums1</code> and <code>nums2</code> of size <code>m</code> and <code>n</code> respectively.</p>
<p>Find the median of the two sorted arrays. Assume both arrays are non-empty.</p>
<p><strong>Test cases</strong>:</p>
<p>Each list must have at least one value, should be sorted from least to greatest and should only contain integers.</p>
<p><strong>Sum of length of lists is an odd number</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>nums1=[1]</code> and <code>nums2=[1, 2]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 1 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 2</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 3</li>
<li>Median is 1</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 1 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 2)</code> since 2nd argument exclusive</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>nums1=[1]</code> and <code>nums2=[1, 2, 3, 4]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 1 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 4</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 5</li>
<li>Median is 2</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 2 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 3)</code></li>
<li>A <em>special</em> edge case: want to keep on iterating over elements <code>nums2</code> and can't utilize index greater than 0 for <code>nums1</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>nums1=[1, 5]</code> and <code>nums2=[0, 3, 6]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 2 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 3</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 5</li>
<li>Median is 3</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 2 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 3)</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Sum of length of lists is an even number</strong>:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>nums1=[1]</code> and <code>nums2=[2]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 1 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 1</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 2.</li>
<li>Median is (1+2)/2 = 1.5</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 1 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 2)</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>nums1=[1]</code> and <code>nums2=[2, 4, 6]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 1 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 3</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 4</li>
<li>Median is (2+4)/2 = 3</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 2 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 3)</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>nums1=[1, 3]</code> and <code>nums2=[2, 4]</code><ul>
<li><code>len(nums1)</code> = 2 and <code>len(nums2)</code> = 2</li>
<li>Sum of length of lists is 4</li>
<li>Median is (2+3)/2 = 2.5</li>
<li>Need to traverse to index 2 of combined lists - equivalent to <code>range(0, 3)</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Let's write out Python test cases.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1], [1, 2]) == 1</span>
<span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1], [1, 2, 3, 4]) == 2</span>
<span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1, 5], [0, 3, 6]) == 3</span>
<span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1], [2]) == 1.5</span>
<span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1], [2, 4, 6]) == 3</span>
<span class="c1"># assert find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays([1, 3], [2, 4]) == 2.5</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Brute-Force-Method">Brute Force Method<a class="anchor-link" href="#Brute-Force-Method">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In general, I think it's best practice to first try to solve the problem using brute force - meaning solve it by any means necessary - even if it's not best-performant code. Use the plethora of Python functions, data structures and methods to derive the solution in the quickest way you know possible.</p>
<p>Programming in the real world, in most cases, just solved in a quick fashion - likely the brute force way - is more optimal than solving the problem over a long duration with more performant code that uses less memory and computes in a shorter time period. Once the problem is solved, then work on optimizing it to be better.</p>
<h4 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h4><p>We have two sorted lists. It's confusing to work with two separate data structures and manage iterating over them. Therefore, I think it's simplest to create one sorted list.</p>
<p>There are two formulas to find the median of a list - one if the list has an even number of elements and another if the list has an odd number of elements.</p>
<p>Since there will be one sorted list, I can easily retrieve the element(s) at a given index needed to calculate the median.</p>
<p>This method isn't performant because it's high time complexity to sort a list and additional space complexity to store a new sorted list. My hypothesis is that there's a simpler time complexity way that may involve just one iteration over half of <code>m</code> + <code>n</code> in order to find the median value.</p>
<h4 id="Coded-Solution">Coded Solution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Coded-Solution">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">logging</span>
<span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">basicConfig</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DEBUG</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%(asctime)-25s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(levelname)-7s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(lineno)-4s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(message)-8s</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>                      

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    Find the median of two sorted arrays through iterating over one combined sorted list.</span>
<span class="sd">    Reach middle index and calculate median based on specific formula relative to count of </span>
<span class="sd">    elements in combined list.</span>
<span class="sd">    </span>
<span class="sd">    param nums1: first sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    param nums2: second sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    return median: median of two sorted lists    </span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create one sorted list from nums1 and nums2..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">sorted_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"calculate the length of sorted_list..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"given 2-number sorted list, calculate average of two middle numbers in list..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"given even numbered sorted_list, use Python floor division operator to calculate two middle # indices..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">lower_middle_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">higher_middle_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"calculate median as "</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">lower_middle_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">higher_middle_index</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"given odd-numbered sorted_list, calculate median as exact middle value..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">exact_middle_list_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">len_sorted_list</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sorted_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">exact_middle_list_index</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"median: </span><span class="si">{median}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">median</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>All the test cases below pass.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="inner_cell">

</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div><div class="inner_cell">

<p>Turn off logger messages for verifying rest of test cases.</p>

</div>
</div>

<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logger</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">getLogger</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">logger</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">disabled</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mf">1.5</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mf">2.5</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="A-More-Performant-Method">A More Performant Method<a class="anchor-link" href="#A-More-Performant-Method">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Pseudocode">Pseudocode<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pseudocode">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># a python deque is a great data structure for quick O(1) pops at the front - unlike a list</span>
<span class="c1"># assign a Python deque to store the values of nums1</span>
<span class="c1"># assign a Python deque to store the values of nums2</span>

<span class="c1"># assign variable sum_length_two_lists to be sum of the lengths of the input lists</span>
<span class="c1"># assign variable last_iterated_value to be None</span>

<span class="c1"># as we iterate over each list, we'll compare the values at index 0 of each list...</span>
<span class="c1"># create a function called element_comparisons_on_lists that takes in inputs nums1, nums2, and last_iterated_value</span>
    <span class="c1"># NEED TO CHECK LENGTH OF LIST...</span>
    <span class="c1"># if len(nums2) is equal to 0 or nums1[0] <= nums2[0]:</span>
        <span class="c1"># pop out first element of nums1 and assign it to last_iterated_value</span>
    <span class="c1"># else:</span>
        <span class="c1"># pop out first element of nums2 and assign it to last_iterated_value</span>
    <span class="c1"># return nums1, nums2 and last_iterated_value</span>

<span class="c1"># if sum_length_two_lists is equal to two:</span>
    <span class="c1"># calculate median as average of two values - the one in east list</span>
<span class="c1"># else if sum_length_two_lists is even number:</span>
    <span class="c1"># assign middle_values_list to be empty python list</span>
    <span class="c1"># create python set of lower-middle-index and upper-middle-index</span>
    <span class="c1"># iterate from combined_index in range(0, upper-middle-# + 1)</span>
        <span class="c1"># if combined_index in python set:</span>
            <span class="c1"># append element to middle_values_list</span>
        <span class="c1"># call element_comparisons_on_lists and return values</span>
    <span class="c1"># median is average of two numbers in middle_values_list</span>
<span class="c1"># else:</span>
    <span class="c1"># sum_length_two_lists is an odd number...</span>
    <span class="c1"># iterate from combined_index in range(0, middle number in list + 1)</span>
        <span class="c1"># call element_comparisons_on_lists and return values</span>
    <span class="c1"># median is last_iterated_value</span>
<span class="c1"># return median</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Algorithm-Coded">Algorithm Coded<a class="anchor-link" href="#Algorithm-Coded">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">collections</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">deque</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">element_comparisons_on_lists</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    Compute the smaller element of the two sorted lists and remove that value from deque</span>
<span class="sd">    </span>
<span class="sd">    param nums1: first sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    param nums2: second sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    last_iterated_value: the smaller of available elements in each of two sorted lists</span>
<span class="sd">    return nums1, nums2, last_iterated_value</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span> 
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"no elements in nums2; pop out first element of nums1 and assign it to last_iterated_value"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">popleft</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"no elements in nums1; pop out first element of nums2 and assign it to last_iterated_value"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">popleft</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"pop out first element of nums1 and assign it to last_iterated_value"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">popleft</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"pop out first element of nums2 and assign it to last_iterated_value"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">popleft</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"nums1: </span><span class="si">{nums1}</span><span class="s2"> and nums2: </span><span class="si">{nums2}</span><span class="s2"> and last_iterated_value: </span><span class="si">{last_iterated_value}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    Find the median of two sorted arrays through iterating over lists to reach middle index and using median</span>
<span class="sd">    function specific to the total count of elements in nums1 and nums2</span>
<span class="sd">    </span>
<span class="sd">    param nums1: first sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    param nums2: second sorted list</span>
<span class="sd">    return median: median of two sorted lists</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>
    <span class="c1"># a python deque is a great data structure for quick O(1) pops at the front - unlike a list</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign a Python deque to store the values of nums1..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">nums1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">deque</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign a Python deque to store the values of nums2..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">nums2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">deque</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign variable sum_length_two_lists to be sum of the lengths of the input lists..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"sum_length_two_lists: </span><span class="si">{sum_length_two_lists}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign variable last_iterated_value to be None..."</span><span class="p">)</span> 
    <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">None</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"as we iterate over each list, we'll compare the values at index 0 of each list..."</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"calculate median as average of two values - the one in each list"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"sum_length_two_lists is an even number"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign middle_values_list to be empty python list..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">middle_values_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create python set of lower-middle-index and upper-middle-index"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">set_middle_indices</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">}</span>

        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"iterate over roughly half the indices in sum_length_two_lists..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="c1"># need +1 on right side b/c it's exclusive and we need to reach index at sum_length_two_lists // 2</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">combined_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"combined_index: </span><span class="si">{combined_index}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">element_comparisons_on_lists</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span><span class="p">)</span>

            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"check if we've reached index of index in list to calculate the median..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">combined_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">set_middle_indices</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">middle_values_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">last_iterated_value</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"middle_values_list: </span><span class="si">{middle_values_list}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>  
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">middle_values_list</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span> 
    <span class="c1"># else:</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"iterate over roughly half the indices in sum_length_two_lists..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">combined_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sum_length_two_lists</span> <span class="o">//</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"combined_index: </span><span class="si">{combined_index}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">element_comparisons_on_lists</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nums2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">median</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">last_iterated_value</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"median: </span><span class="si">{median}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">median</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Verify test cases. All pass.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mf">1.5</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">find_median_of_two_sorted_arrays</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mf">2.5</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

entry.title: Largest Substring Without Repeating Characters (via Leetcode)
entry.summary: Extensive walkthrough of finding the largest substring in a string of unique consecutive characters.

  align-items: stretch;
