  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}





.rendered_html pre,




.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,


.rendered_html tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #f5f5f5;
}
.rendered_html tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(66, 165, 245, 0.2);
}
.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,


.rendered_html * + .alert {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.highlight .vm { color: #19177C } /* Name.Variable.Magic */
.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This example was found on <a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/longest-substring-without-repeating-characters/submissions/" target="_blank">Leetcode</a>.</p>
<p>In this tutorial, I'll walk extensively through my logic for solving this problem.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Problem statement:</strong></p>
<p>Given a string of characters, find the length of the largest substring of unique consecutive characters.</p>
<p>Below are some example inputs and the expected output integer.</p>
<p>The function will be called <code>largest_unique_substring()</code> and will take an input as a string and return an integer</p>
<p>Below are some commented out test cases we'll check after the function is created.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assert largest_unique_substring("abcabcbb") == 3  # "abc" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters</span>
<span class="c1"># assert largest_unique_substring("bbbbbbbb") == 1  # "b" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters</span>
<span class="c1"># assert largest_unique_substring("badcajd") == 4  # "badc" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters </span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Import-Modules">Import Modules<a class="anchor-link" href="#Import-Modules">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">logging</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Setup format of logging messages.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">basicConfig</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DEBUG</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%(asctime)-25s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(levelname)-7s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(lineno)-4s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(message)-8s</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>                      
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="My-Setup-Logic">My Setup Logic<a class="anchor-link" href="#My-Setup-Logic">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I think I can calculate the solution in O(n) as I should only need to iterate over the length of elements in the input string, <code>n</code>, once. As I iterate over the input string, I picture utilizing a storage of a moving window that holds the characters the largest running substring and can be reset to an empty string whenever I come across a non-unique element that already exists in the substring.</p>
<p>I need a variable that holds an integer for the length of the largest running substring. I'll call it <code>largest_substring_length</code>.</p>
<p>As I iterate over the string, I'll create several substrings and continually compare its length to <code>largest_substring_length</code>. I only want to create a bigger and bigger substring so long as it holds unique values. Ideally I want as quick lookup as possible to see if an element in input string exists in my running substring. In Python, an optimal data structure to hold unique elements and allow for O(1) time lookup of an element in the data structure is a <a href="https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/datastructures.html#sets" target="_blank">set</a>. I'll call the data structure <code>set_values</code>.</p>
<p>Given these data structures, I want to write pseudocode to devise the logic for the solution.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># assign variable substring_set to be an empty set</span>
<span class="c1"># assign variable largest_substring_length to 0</span>

<span class="c1"># iterate over each element in the input string:</span>
    <span class="c1"># if element exists in substring_set:</span>
        <span class="c1"># this element's value already exists in substring_set so it shouldn't be added to substring_set</span>
        <span class="c1"># assign variable substring_set to be an empty set (again)</span>
    <span class="c1"># else:</span>
        <span class="c1"># element does not exist in substring_set...</span>
        <span class="c1"># add element to end of substring_set</span>
        <span class="c1"># check if length of substring_set is greater than largest_substring_length...</span>
        <span class="c1"># if length of substring_set is greater than largest_substring_length:</span>
            <span class="c1"># assign largest_substring_length to be the length of substring_set</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Coded-Solution">Coded Solution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Coded-Solution">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">largest_unique_substring</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    param input_string: Python string of any length</span>
<span class="sd">    return largest_substring_length: integer to represent length of characters in largest substring of unique consecutive values</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign variable substring_set to be an empty set"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">substring_set</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign variable largest_substring_length to 0"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">largest_substring_length</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span> 

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"iterate over each element in the input string..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">element</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">input_string</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"element: </span><span class="si">{element}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"compare if element exists in substring_set..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">element</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">substring_set</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"this element's value already exists in substring_set so it shouldn't be added to substring_set..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# assign variable substring_set to be an empty set (again)"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">substring_set</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"element does not exist in substring_set..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"add element to end of substring_set"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">substring_set</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">element</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"current substring_set: </span><span class="si">{substring_set}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign variable substring_set_length to be the length of substring_set"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">substring_set_length</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">substring_set</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"current substring_set_length: </span><span class="si">{substring_set_length}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"check if length of substring_set is greater than largest_substring_length..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">substring_set</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="n">largest_substring_length</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"assign largest_substring_length to be the length of substring_set"</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">largest_substring_length</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">substring_set_length</span>
                <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"current largest_substring_length: </span><span class="si">{largest_substring_length}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">largest_substring_length</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The function above can be written in 12 lines but I always recommend including logging messages to ensure the code works as you expect.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Test-Cases">Test Cases<a class="anchor-link" href="#Test-Cases">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's validate the loggging messages with our first test case above.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">largest_unique_substring</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"abcabcbb"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span>  <span class="c1"># "abc" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's turn logging messages off and run the next two test cases.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logger</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">getLogger</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">logger</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">disabled</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">largest_unique_substring</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"bbbbbbbb"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span>  <span class="c1"># "b" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters</span>
<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">largest_unique_substring</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"badcajd"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">4</span>  <span class="c1"># "badc" is largest substring of unique consecutive characters </span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
 


<script type="text/javascript">if (!document.getElementById('mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#')) {
    var mathjaxscript = document.createElement('script');
    mathjaxscript.id = 'mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#';
    mathjaxscript.type = 'text/javascript';
    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>

entry.title: Command Line Basic Minesweeper
entry.summary: Medium Python algorithm prototype of a basic version of Minesweeper as a command line game
entry.content:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*
* IPython notebook
*
*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */
.ansi-black-fg {
  color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-bg {
  background-color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-intense-fg {
  color: #282C36;
}
.ansi-black-intense-bg {
  background-color: #282C36;
}
.ansi-red-fg {
  color: #E75C58;
}
.ansi-red-bg {
  background-color: #E75C58;
}
.ansi-red-intense-fg {
  color: #B22B31;
}
.ansi-red-intense-bg {
  background-color: #B22B31;
}
.ansi-green-fg {
  color: #00A250;
}
.ansi-green-bg {
  background-color: #00A250;
}
.ansi-green-intense-fg {
  color: #007427;
}
.ansi-green-intense-bg {
  background-color: #007427;
}
.ansi-yellow-fg {

}
.ansi-yellow-bg {

}

}
.ansi-yellow-intense-bg {

}
.ansi-blue-fg {

}

}
.ansi-blue-intense-fg {

}
.ansi-blue-intense-bg {
  background-color: #0065CA;
}
.ansi-magenta-fg {
  color: #D160C4;
}
.ansi-magenta-bg {
  background-color: #D160C4;
}
.ansi-magenta-intense-fg {
  color: #A03196;
}
.ansi-magenta-intense-bg {
  background-color: #A03196;
}
.ansi-cyan-fg {
  color: #60C6C8;
}
.ansi-cyan-bg {

}
.ansi-cyan-intense-fg {

}

}

}

}
.ansi-default-inverse-fg {
  color: #FFFFFF;
}
.ansi-default-inverse-bg {
  background-color: #000000;
}
.ansi-bold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
.ansi-underline {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
/* The following styles are deprecated an will be removed in a future version */
.ansibold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
.ansi-inverse {
  outline: 0.5px dotted;
}
/* use dark versions for foreground, to improve visibility */
.ansiblack {
  color: black;
}
.ansired {
  color: darkred;
}
.ansigreen {
  color: darkgreen;
}
.ansiyellow {
  color: #c4a000;
}
.ansiblue {
  color: darkblue;
}
.ansipurple {
  color: darkviolet;
}
.ansicyan {
  color: steelblue;
}
.ansigray {
  color: gray;
}
/* and light for background, for the same reason */
.ansibgblack {
  background-color: black;
}
.ansibgred {
  background-color: red;
}
.ansibggreen {
  background-color: green;
}
.ansibgyellow {
  background-color: yellow;
}
.ansibgblue {
  background-color: blue;
}
.ansibgpurple {
  background-color: magenta;
}
.ansibgcyan {
  background-color: cyan;
}
.ansibggray {
  background-color: gray;
}
div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
/*

Original style from softwaremaniacs.org (c) Ivan Sagalaev <Maniac@SoftwareManiacs.Org>
Adapted from GitHub theme

*/
.highlight-base {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.highlight-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}
.highlight-string {
  color: #BA2121;
}
.highlight-comment {
  color: #408080;
  font-style: italic;
}
.highlight-number {
  color: #080;
}
.highlight-atom {
  color: #88F;
}
.highlight-keyword {
  color: #008000;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-builtin {
  color: #008000;
}
.highlight-error {
  color: #f00;
}
.highlight-operator {
  color: #AA22FF;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
/* previously not defined, copying from default codemirror */
.highlight-def {
  color: #00f;
}
.highlight-string-2 {
  color: #f50;
}
.highlight-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.highlight-bracket {

.highlight-attribute {

}
.highlight-header {

}
.highlight-quote {

}

}

.cm-s-ipython span.cm-keyword {

.cm-s-ipython span.cm-tab {
  background: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAADAAAAAMCAYAAAAkuj5RAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAGFJREFUSMft1LsRQFAQheHPowAKoACx3IgEKtaEHujDjORSgWTH/ZOdnZOcM/sgk/kFFWY0qV8foQwS4MKBCS3qR6ixBJvElOobYAtivseIE120FaowJPN75GMu8j/LfMwNjh4HUpwg4LUAAAAASUVORK5CYII=);
  background-position: right;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}

  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */

  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}

  margin-top: 1em;
}

}

}

.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}

}

}

}

.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this implementation, the minefield grid is always 4x4 and there's just one mine on the field.</p>
<p>Additional work could be done on this Minesweeper implementation to allow for more adjustable field sizes, additional mines on the field and automatic reveal of coordinates that don't contain any adjacent mines.</p>
<p>For a more robust code solution, I'd recommend more modularity with functions and the use of object-oriented programming to easily allow for reuse of code with inheritance, extensability to various platforms and additional benefits.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">random</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">randint</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">itertools</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">logging</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">time</span>

<span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">basicConfig</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DEBUG</span><span class="p">,</span>
                    <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%(asctime)-16s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(levelname)-12s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(lineno)-6s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(funcName)-28s</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">%(message)-8s</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                    <span class="n">datefmt</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'%H:%M:%SS'</span>
                    <span class="p">)</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">play_minesweeper</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">minefield_rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>
    <span class="n">minefield_columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"set random mine row and column index given minefield size"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">mine_row_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">randint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_rows</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">mine_column_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">randint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_columns</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"mine is at: (</span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">{1}</span><span class="s2">)"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mine_column_index</span><span class="p">))</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_ones_possible_indices</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_length</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">        Finds all possible indices of 1s that surround mine</span>
<span class="sd">        Function only works under assumption that minefield is square (all sides equal)</span>
<span class="sd">        :param mine_index: index of the mine for its corresponding row or column</span>
<span class="sd">        :param minefield_length: count of squares along one edge of minefield</span>
<span class="sd">        :return: one_indices</span>
<span class="sd">        """</span>
        <span class="n">one_indices</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">minefield_length</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"mine is located in the bottom row of hidden_minefield"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"1s can only be in 2nd to bottom row and bottom row of hidden_minefield"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">one_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
                <span class="n">one_indices</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">one_index</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"mine is in the first aka top row of hidden_minefield"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"1s can only be in the top and 2nd to the top row of hidden_minefield"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">one_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
                <span class="n">one_indices</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">one_index</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"mine is located in one of the middle rows"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"1s can be above, on same and below the row of the mine in hidden_minefield"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">one_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mine_index</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
                <span class="n">one_indices</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">one_index</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">one_indices</span>

    <span class="n">row_ones_indices</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_ones_possible_indices</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"row_ones_indices: </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row_ones_indices</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">column_ones_indices</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_ones_possible_indices</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_column_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_columns</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"column_ones_indices: </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">column_ones_indices</span><span class="p">))</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create list with list items of potential row indices and column indices of 1s"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">coordinate_indices_lists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row_ones_indices</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">column_ones_indices</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"coordinate_indices_lists: </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">coordinate_indices_lists</span><span class="p">))</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create empty list to store all possible coordinates of positions of 1s; not all coord. on field"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ones_coordinates</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"find cartesian product of values in coordinate_indices_lists"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">coordinate</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">itertools</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">product</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">coordinate_indices_lists</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"append coordinate of 1 to ones_coordinates"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">ones_coordinates</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">coordinate</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"ones_coordinates: </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ones_coordinates</span><span class="p">))</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"generate hidden_minefield variable as a list of lists"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">)]</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create counter for all 1s and 0s"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">count_ones_and_zeros</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"loop over all values in hidden_minefield; fill in with appropriate values"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">column_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_columns</span><span class="p">):</span>

            <span class="c1"># check if this value on the hidden_minefield is the value of the mine</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">column_index</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mine_row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mine_column_index</span><span class="p">):</span>
                <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">)</span>

            <span class="c1"># check if this value on the hidden_minefield is in the ones_coordinates list</span>
            <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">column_index</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ones_coordinates</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">count_ones_and_zeros</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

            <span class="c1"># the value is not the mine or adjacent to the mine</span>
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">count_ones_and_zeros</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"output hidden_minefield with each row on a newline"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"create the user interface minefield of all ? values"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">user_interface_minefield</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">)]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">empty_list</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">user_interface_minefield</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_columns</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="n">empty_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'?'</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">logging</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"sleep so print messages appear after logging messages"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">time</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sleep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time for the user to play! Try to avoid the mines!"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># only enough guesses for user to guess all 1s and 0s; otherwise, user guesses mine and game ends</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">guess_counter</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">guess</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">count_ones_and_zeros</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">In minefield, row values start at 1 and go to </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">."</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"In minefield, column values start at 1 and go to </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">."</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">minefield_columns</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">This is the user_interface_minefield:"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">user_interface_minefield</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="c1"># prompt user to guess row and column</span>
        <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_player_input</span><span class="p">():</span>
            <span class="n">guess_row</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Guess row: "</span><span class="p">))</span>
            <span class="n">guess_column</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Guess column: "</span><span class="p">))</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">guess_row</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">guess_column</span>

        <span class="n">guess_row</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">guess_column</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_player_input</span><span class="p">()</span>

        <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">check_condition_guess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_edge_size</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">isinstance</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_row</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="ow">is</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You didn't guess an integer"</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
            <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">guess_index</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="ow">or</span> <span class="n">guess_index</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="n">minefield_edge_size</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Your guess integer is out of range of 1-4"</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span>

        <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">check_condition_guess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_row</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_rows</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">check_condition_guess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_column</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">minefield_columns</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">bad_guess_status</span> <span class="ow">is</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Please make a more appropriate guess"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">continue</span>
   
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Your guessed coordinate: (</span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">{1}</span><span class="s2">)"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_row</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">guess_column</span><span class="p">))</span>

        <span class="c1"># create new variables for offsets of 1 less than guesses because we use zero-based numbering in Python</span>
        <span class="n">user_guess_row_offset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">guess_row</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">user_guess_column_offset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">guess_column</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

        <span class="c1"># make reveal of board and notify user with text change</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">user_guess_row_offset</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">user_guess_column_offset</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You guessed a 1 so you're nearby a mine."</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">user_interface_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">user_guess_row_offset</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">user_guess_column_offset</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'1'</span>

        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">user_guess_row_offset</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">user_guess_column_offset</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You guessed far from a mine. You're ok!"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">user_interface_minefield</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">user_guess_row_offset</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">user_guess_column_offset</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'0'</span>

        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You guessed the mine! You lose!</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Here's what the minefield looks like:"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">hidden_minefield</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">break</span>

        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">guess_counter</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You have made </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2"> guess"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_counter</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You have made </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2"> guesses"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess_counter</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">play_minesweeper</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: Two Sums (via Leetcode)
entry.summary: Beginner Python algorithm problem with practical applications to the Big O notation.
entry.content:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*

*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */

}

}

}

}

}

}

}
